greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: This table shows the coefficients of combinatorial formulas needed for generating the sequential sums of p-th powers of binomial coefficients C(n,4). The p-th row (p>=1) contains a(i,p) for i=1 to 4*p-3, where a(i,p) satisfies Sum_{i=1..n} C(i+3,4)^p = 5 * C(n+4,5) * Sum_{i=1..4*p-3} a(i,p) * C(n-1,i-1)/(i+4).
comment: The table entries T(n,k) are the coefficients when expressing the polynomial C(x+4,4)^p of degree 4*p in terms of falling factorials: C(x+4,4)^p = Sum_{k = 0..4*p} T(p,k)*C(x,k). It follows that Sum_{i = 0..n-1} C(i+4,4)^p = Sum_{k = 0..4*p} T(p,k)*C(n,k+1). (End)
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
Dukes, C. D. White, Web Matrices: Structural Properties and Generating Combinatorial Identities, arXiv:1603.01589 [math.CO], 2016.
formula: The following remarks assume the row and column indices start at 0.

T(n,k) = Sum_{i = 0..k} (-1)^(k-i)*binomial(k,i) * binomial(i+4,4)^n. Equivalently, let v_n denote the sequence (1, 5^n, 15^n, 35^n, ...) regarded as an infinite column vector, where 1, 5, 15, 35, ... is the sequence binomial(n+4,4) - see A000332. Then the n-th row of this table is determined by the matrix product P^(-1)*v_n, where P denotes Pascal's triangle A007318.
Recurrence: T(n+1,k) = C(k+4,4)*T(n,k) + 4*C(k+3,4)*T(n,k-1) + 6*C(k+2,4)*T(n,k-2) + 4*C(k+1,4)*T(n,k-3) + C(k,4)*T(n,k-4) with boundary conditions T(n,0) = 1 for all n and T(n,k) = 0 for k > 4*n.
n-th row polynomial R(n,x) = (1 + x)^4 o (1 + x)^4 o ... o (1 + x)^4 (n factors), where o denotes the black diamond product of power series defined in Dukes and White.
(1 - x)^(4*n)*R(n,x/(1 - x)) appears to equal the n-th row polynomial of A236463. (End)
maple: seq(seq(add( (-1)^(k-i)*binomial(k, i)*binomial(i+4, 4)^n, i = 0..k), k = 0..4*n), n = 0..6); # _Peter Bala_, Mar 11 2018
program: (PARI) {a(i, p) = sum(k=1, (2*i + 1 + (-1)^(i - 1))/4, binomial(i - 1, 2*k - 2)*binomial(i - 2*k + 5, i - 2*k + 1)^(p - 1) - binomial(i - 1, 2*k - 1)*binomial(i - 2*k + 4, i - 2*k)^(p - 1))}; for(p=1,8, for(i=1, 4*p-3, print1(if(p==1,1,a(i,p)), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 23 2017
results.author: _André F. Labossière_, Aug 11 2003
